tool.name: SAGA.grid_calculus.16
tool.description: Gradient Vector from Polar to Cartesian Coordinates
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDIR False isArrayLEN False output_data_DX $output_data_DX output_data_DY $output_data_DY name SAGA.grid_calculus.16 DIR $DIR LEN $LEN UNITS $UNITS SYSTEM $SYSTEM SYSTEM_ZERO $SYSTEM_ZERO SYSTEM_ORIENT $SYSTEM_ORIENT prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DX $OutputSection_DX.outputType_DX transmissionMode_DX $OutputSection_DX.transmissionMode_DX outputType_DY $OutputSection_DY.outputType_DY transmissionMode_DY $OutputSection_DY.transmissionMode_DY

param.name: DIR
param.label: Direction
param.help: Direction The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: LEN
param.label: Length
param.help: Length The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: SYSTEM_ZERO
param.label: User defined Zero Direction
param.help: given in degree clockwise from North direction

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DX
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_DY
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: Converts gradient vector from polar coordinates (direction or aspect angle and length or tangens of slope) to directional components (Cartesian).<br/>The tool supports three conventions on how the angle of direction can be supplied:<br/>(a) mathematical: direction angle is zero in East direction and the angle increases counterclockwise<br/>(b) geographical: direction angle is zero in North direction and the angle increases clockwise<br/>(c) zero direction and orientation are user defined<br/>
